"Wrong  user/password" error while using BASIC auth-method under WIN NT 4.0 
Server/Client ServicePack 6.0/4.0, Sun JDK 1.3.0. Web clients: IE 5.0 & NS 4.7.

I try to go to "http://host/shop/admin/" with my browser. When I type "tomcat" 
login and "tomcat" password in password confirmation, browser says "login 
fails" (NS) or retries login dialog (IE). Here is my web.xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>

<!DOCTYPE web-app
    PUBLIC "-//Sun Microsystems, Inc.//DTD Web Application 2.2//EN"
    "http://java.sun.com/j2ee/dtds/web-app_2_2.dtd">

<web-app>
   <login-config>
     <auth-method>BASIC</auth-method>
     <realm-name>
       examples
     </realm-name>
   </login-config>

   <security-role>
     <role-name>
       tomcat
     </role-name>
   </security-role>

   <security-constraint>
     <web-resource-collection>
       <web-resource-name>
         shop
       </web-resource-name>
       <url-pattern>
         /admin/*
       </url-pattern>
     </web-resource-collection>
     <auth-constraint>
       <role-name>
         tomcat
       </role-name>
     </auth-constraint>
   </security-constraint>
</web-app>

And here is My tomcat-users.xml:
<tomcat-users>
  <user name="tomcat" password="tomcat" roles="tomcat" />
</tomcat-users>

Here is what appeared in the tomcat.log file:
<l:ctx path="/shop" >Error/loop in default error handler R( /shop +  + /admin/) 
401 null null</l:ctx>
